intro: Hesperastragalus brazoensis, commonly known as the Brazoensis milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically visited by pollinators such as bees. Hesperastragalus brazoensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its ecological importance includes providing nectar sources and habitat for various insects and supporting local biodiversity.
